intro: Chrysothamnus gnaphalodes, commonly known as the yellow rabbitbrush, is a shrub native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and produces small, fluffy seed heads that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sagebrush steppe and rocky soils. It has a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions and is adapted to resist drought. The species is also valued for its role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for wildlife.
